column4: Is there a way to get packages installed on a machine that can't see the outside world? I have my desktop that can access the machine and the outside world and would like to install some packages on the machine that can't see outside using apt-get
you need to download the ubuntu .deb package files
make sure you check the dependencies and satisfy those also
what are you trying to install?
sun-java-jre
Trying to install Openfire IM server on an ubuntu server but it needs java installed   .. I could have sword it wanted a sun-java6-dev or something but didn't see that in the repo
What does your other computer run?
this machine is on xubuntu 8.04 and server is ubuntu server 8.04
ok. are they on a network?
http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy/sun-java6-jre take a look at that
I am ssh'd into the server atm - not sure why but it can't access the outside world and I'm not too worried about. I'll just scp the deb file over and manually do it
http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy/sun-java6-jre take a look at that
at the top you can navigate the dependencies and at the bottom you can download the files
thx :)
No Problem; Thank the community
I assume these packages will run on 64bit machines?
you didn't say that one second
Yeah I just realized I forgot to mention that part :P
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/hardy/amd64/sun-java6-jre
I also, moved over to the sun-java6-sdk and saw the AMD64 so downloading that now. As for depends not so sure
you can check this out. http://linuxappfinder.com/package/sun-java6-jre
I PM'd you
